headline.main: Despite Numbers of Applicants, Few Civilians Are Selected as Astronauts

results.snippet: LEAD: The idea that any qualified American could become an astronaut has given way to the reality that almost no one outside the military services or the space agency has a chance, according to a Congressman and statistics supplied by the space...

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The idea that any qualified American could become an astronaut has given way to the reality that almost no one outside the military services or the space agency has a chance, according to a Congressman and statistics supplied by the space agency. The result, critics say, is an astronaut corps of increasingly narrow experience and outlook.

headline.main: Panel Urges Lunar Station as Step to Mars

results.snippet: LEAD: The United States should avoid a spectacular ''race to Mars'' and instead establish an outpost on the Moon as part of a measured exploration of the solar system, a study team headed by the astronaut Sally K. Ride said today.

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The United States should avoid a spectacular ''race to Mars'' and instead establish an outpost on the Moon as part of a measured exploration of the solar system, a study team headed by the astronaut Sally K. Ride said today.

headline.main: Hayden Rorke, Actor In Film, Plays and TV

results.snippet: LEAD: Hayden Rorke, a stage, screen and television actor whose career spanned six decades, died of cancer Wednesday at his home in Toluca Lake, Calif. He was 76 years old.
results.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Hayden Rorke, a stage, screen and television actor whose career spanned six decades, died of cancer Wednesday at his home in Toluca Lake, Calif. He was 76 years old.

results.snippet: LEAD: 'The establishment of a lunar outpost would be a significant step outward from Earth - a step that combines adventure, science, technology and perhaps the seeds of enterprise. Exploring and prospecting the moon, learning to use lunar resources...
results.lead_paragraph: LEAD: 'The establishment of a lunar outpost would be a significant step outward from Earth - a step that combines adventure, science, technology and perhaps the seeds of enterprise. Exploring and prospecting the moon, learning to use lunar resources and work within lunar constraints, would provide the experience and expertise necessary for further human exploration of the solar system.

headline.main: Reporter's Notebook: Debates Yield To Fun as U.S.-Soviet Meeting Ends

results.snippet: LEAD: Under an opulent tent on the banks of Lake Chautauqua, a Soviet rocket scientist danced with the granddaughter of an American President and sang ''When the Saints Go Marching In'' with a five-piece country-rock band.

byline.original: By ANDREW ROSENTHAL, Special to the New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Under an opulent tent on the banks of Lake Chautauqua, a Soviet rocket scientist danced with the granddaughter of an American President and sang ''When the Saints Go Marching In'' with a five-piece country-rock band.
